metadata.title: Detection of Alphacoronavirus in velvety free-tailed bats (Molossus molossus) and Brazilian free-tailed bats (Tadarida brasiliensis) from urban area of Southern Brazil

FIGREF0.text: Fig. 1: Phylogenetic relationship between the nucleotide sequences corresponding to a portion of 440 bp of the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase gene amplified from insectivorous bat species in Porto Alegre, RS, Brazil. Sequences from other alpha and betacoronaviruses were obtained from GenBanK (accession numbers in the figure). The tree was generated based on the neighbor joining method in the MEGA program. The nucleotide sequence of the equivalent genome fragment of SARS-CoV was included as outgroup

BIBREF0.venue: Mammal Species of the World: A Taxonomic Reference

BIBREF1.venue: Rev. Inst. Med. Trop. Sao Paulo

BIBREF6.title: BioEdit: a user-friendly biological sequence alignment editor and analysis program for Windows 95/98/NT
